creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
As mentioned in bug 43283, strings such as ".jmx", ".jtl" etc should probably 
be replaced with constant strings in a common file.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 27544
Fix to the issue

Thanks for the patch, but I don't think FileDialoger is the correct place for such constants.

It's a gui class, and the file extensions also apply to non-GUI code.
Also, I think we need better names for the constants.

This should wait until after 2.5.1
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Hi Again,
If you look at place where these ".jmx" and ".jtl" are used, except for org.apache.jmeter.JMeter class, all are visual classes or related no ?:
- org.apache.jmeter.control.gui.IncludeControllerGui
-org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.Analyze
-org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.Load
-org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.Save
-org.apache.jmeter.gui.util.FileDialoger
-org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.gui.AbstractVisualizer
-org.apache.jmeter.gui.util.ReportFileDialoger

I searched for a Constants class but the only one I found was org.apache.jmeter.monitor.parser, 
let me know where you want to put it and how to name it.

Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
